page.title: 13Badlesmere-Family & Homelife
page.content: Families generally are small and life centres around the home and community. Transport is difficult and many families run two cars. As the children grow up, many mothers return to work at least part-time. Children tend to leave home by the age of l8 often to further education. Although the ability to cook well is considered important, because of the time factor, many rely on pre-packed convenience foods. Emphasis is put on healthy eating and many families have freezers for their own and bought produce. Shopping is done either weekly or monthly in supermarkets. Microwave ovens and automatic washing machines and other labour saving gadgets are in common use. For busy families the emphasis today is on saving time.
